alert.note: Alert for Eastern Las Animas County Including Pinon Canyon (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 27 at 3:54AM MST until February 27 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A Red Flag Warning has been issued for portions of the I-25 corridor and parts of the eastern plains for Monday afternoon... ...A Fire Weather Watch has been issued for portions of the area for Tuesday afternoon... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 233... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 233... The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 5 PM MST this afternoon. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low relative humidity is in effect from Tuesday morning through Tuesday afternoon. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 233. * Winds...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 11 percent.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
